title: Security Systems Engineer
description:
We’re looking for an energetic, career-driven, passionate, autonomous, experienced, self-driven Systems Security Engineer to join our growing team.

Essential duties:

  • Architecture design, implement and monitor security measures for the protection of computer systems, networks and information.
  • Engineer and implement security solutions for customers using technologies that meet their needs.
  • Provide timely issue resolutions by evaluating, tracking, escalating, managing of all requests/problems reported.

Security Risk Management

  • Identify and validate cyber threats and their potential impact to the IT infrastructure.
  • Monitor and analyze logs and alerts from various systems including cloud gateways, firewalls, email servers and endpoint protection systems.
  • Perform internal and external vulnerability assessment and penetration testing.
  • Conduct security risk assessments on new applications, products and systems, periodic security risk assessments on existing systems and identify and/or recommend appropriate security countermeasures and best practices.
  • Manage vulnerability scanning systems and help prioritize and mitigate any existing vulnerabilities whether via patches or other compensating controls.
  • Analyzing security breaches to identify the root cause and continuously update the company’s incident response and disaster recovery plans.
  • Participate in security incident handling and response; and participate in the mitigation and remediation of security vulnerabilities affecting host workstations and servers of JDL Group and its customers.
  • Perform Firewall rules Audit and Certification as per NCUA, SHIELD ACT and PCI compliance requirement.
  • Ensure compliance to security industry standards including NIST, PCI DSS, and FISMA specific requirements or policies.

Network and System Management

  • Install, configure, troubleshoot and manage Firewalls, Intrusion Prevention and Detection Systems.
  • Work on Routers, switches, server operating systems, active directory, firewalls, wireless controllers, DNS, DHCP, email and file servers, virtual machines and software applications.
  • Monitor network performance, troubleshoot issues and bottlenecks to maintain optimal network performance.
  • Maintain network security by establishing and enforcing policies, monitoring access, and implementing regular security testing procedures.
  • Utilize the client’s tools, capabilities, and processes to identify network, system and security related issues.
  • Work with public cloud service providers such as Amazon AWS or Microsoft Azure.
  • Windows and Linux Operating Systems solution design, implementation and support.

Information security awareness campaign and training

  • Contribute to the development and implementation of a security training program, and advise other professionals who do not specialize in security, in particular the staff of JDL and its clients.

Documentation, Reporting and Analytics

  • Prepare an operational reporting framework (workflow report) that provides regular metrics and statistics about IT procedures.
  • Contribute to design customization of system configuration and deployment guides.
  • Prepare network topology diagrams, process diagrams and device inventory diagrams.
  • Prepare monthly / quarterly / annual security assessment reports for clients to maintain continuous compliance.
  • Provide subject matter expertise for all security exceptions that could negatively impact security risks and/or not adhere to established policies, standards, or procedures.

Required Experience and Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information, Network and Computer Security or Computer Science or Information Technology or Information Security is required
  • Excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills
  • Ability to learn quickly and comprehend technical as well as business concepts
  • Industry recognized Certifications like CCNA or AWS is preferred

Please send your resume to sales@jdlgrp.com. Let us know what position that you are applying for and we will contact you shortly.

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
The Cyber Security InfoSec Engineer provides security engineering designs and implementation in all aspects of Information Assurance and Information Security (InfoSec) Engineering. Assesses and mitigates system security threats/risks throughout the program life cycle; validates system security requirements definition and analysis; establishes system security designs; implements security designs in hardware, software, data, and procedures; verifies security requirements; performs system certification and accreditation planning and testing and liaison activities, and supports secure systems operations and maintenance.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:


  • Demonstrated experience performing A&A activities in support of software and system requirements, design, development, testing and sustainment
  • Experience with employment of A&A requirements, policies, and processes
  • Experience with risk and vulnerability assessments and mitigation
  • Demonstrated ability to provide guidance on Intelligence Community (IC) Cyber/IA regulations and requirements to senior customers, senior leaders, and the program staff
  • Experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) correlation tools, Scanning (Nessus), and Host Based Security System (HBSS)
  • Experience with Secure Configuration/Hardening of Information Systems (STIG compliance)


DESIRED SKILLS:

  • Experience with system audit configuration, capture, analysis, and risk reduction
  • Experience supporting IC IA Programs
  • Understanding of Windows Active Directory, Group Policy, Configuration Management as well as common services such as SCCM, IIS, Exchange, Domain Controllers etc.

DESIRED CERTIFICATIONS:

Security+ or CISSP certification




QVine Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer—M/F/D/V

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
Provide IT security engineering, integration services and solutions. This includes malicious code detection, intrusion detection, and information security tool development and integration.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

  • Analyze systems, including forensically, for malware, misuse, and/or unauthorized activity.
  • Investigate and report on virus/malware alerts/incidents to determine root cause, entry point of code, damage risk. Analyze all data sources, to include Internet,
  • Intelligence Community reporting, security events, firewall logs, forensic hard-drive images, and other data sources to identify malware, misuse, unauthorized activity or other cyber security related concerns.
  • Monitor, document, and respond to centrally collected virus alerts.
  • Participate in project review meetings and provide technical cyber security guidance.
  • Refine, edit, and maintain training materials, including maintenance of a small training/demonstration network, execute training class.
  • Track, on a daily basis, intelligence (both open and classified sources) concerning malicious code threats and assist in preparation of a daily report to senior management on the current status of a threat and ability to counteract that threat.
  • Write reports for Sponsor on the detailed technical analysis results.
  • Communicate complex technical concepts and project information clearly and concisely to technical and non-technical audiences, write technical documents addressing intricate, sensitive issues.
  • Create complex system designs, resolve engineering problems, and propose preventive strategies.
    Identify new technologies and assess their technical and performance characteristics.
  • Display knowledge of computing design concepts and implementation.
  • Possess strong interpersonal, organizational, writing, communications, analytical and briefing skills.
  • Possess knowledge of encryption technologies, identity and authentication technologies, Information Assurance assessment tools, Lotus Notes, Microsoft Office and Network Defense monitoring tools and systems.

title: IT Security Specialist
description:
QVine is seeking a candidate with Network Engineering experience and skills. The analyst will support the customer's overall threat analysis efforts by performing technical assessments on IT infrastructure components, malicious code, and Advance Persistent Threat capabilities as they relate to computer networking. The candidate will be expect to conduct IT network forensic assessments across a full spectrum of computer and network devices, Windows/Linux hosts, mobile devices, virtual machines, and software and hardware, to determine potential weaknesses and vulnerabilities that may affect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of corporate protected and sensitive information systems and data.
Required skills:
  • Must have a current Encase certification
  • Experience with mobile OS, Android, iOS
  • Candidate must have a proven ability to perform complete digital forensic analysis from acquisition to report with minimal assistance
  • Candidate must have a demonstrated technical aptitude such as a computer science degree or a previous position in a computer related field with a minimum 5 year work experience
  • Minimum three years experience examining any of the following media types: cell phones, hard drives, thumb drives, flash media, compact discs, etc.
  • Candidate must have proven ability to create detailed technical reports and communicate highly technical information to a wide range of non-technical individuals
  • Experience with any of the standard commercial forensic tools including FTK, Paraben, Helix, Ilook, Xways, WireShark, FireEye
  • Experience with Macintosh OS
  • Programming experience with Java, C, C++, Perl, Python, Enscripts
  • Experience with Linux/Unix
  • Familiarity with computer networks, information security systems and associated technologies
Desired skills:
* * Certifications: MCSE, MCITP, PMP
Bachelors degree in CS, Engineering or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience. Ten plus years of network/system engineering experience in a secure environment and five plus years supporting mission based IP networks

title: System Engineer
description:
Systems Engineer (SE) to provide media analysis capabilities utilizing computer and network forensic tools and methods, scripting or macro languages, various software applications, operating system tools, or database tools to review collected media. The SE will translate non-technical user requirements into a working model/website/workflow to fulfill the needs of the user(s) to triage and analyze data. This will be a challenging, dynamic position that will evolve as the overall effort progresses and will require an understanding of the needs of a large and diverse group of users and other project stakeholders.

Mandatory Requirements
  • Demonstrated on-the-job experience, and knowledge of computer and network forensic tools and methods, scripting or macro languages, various related software applications, operating system tools, or database tools to review collected media.
  • Demonstrated on-the-job experience in Java development and JavaServer Pages Standard Tag Libraries (JSTL) front-end design/development. Development experience with Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server databases.
  • Demonstrated on-the-job experience and ability to coordinate user needs between both technical and Non-technical audiences.
  • Demonstrated on-the-job experience working in a team environment and coordinating technical activities.
Optional Skills
  • Good Communication Skills
  • Team Player
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Work with outside data sources and API's.
  • Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.
  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.
Additional Information
Responsibilities will include the use of computer and network forensic tools and methods, various software applications, operating system tools, and/or database tools to review data. Additionally, the SE will extract information and the conduct the research to drive the development of new tools for isolating, collecting, manipulating, and fully utilizing the data. SE will analyze, identify, and recommend innovative and time-tested technical approaches and methods to meet customer needs. SE will identify, deploy and utilize complex applications, tools, and systems while generating complete, consistent, and operationally defined solutions. The SE will work with high-level system requirements based on user needs and constraints that are compatible with existing infrastructure and strict security requirements. SE must coordinate with project stakeholders, including senior management, Sponsor partners in the project, and users. The SE will occasionally produce documentation to inform technical and non-technical stakeholders and assist in the development of new and existing tools. The SE will interface with implementation engineers and users to ensure development proceeds, and any problems are resolved, in accordance with user needs.

title: Security Analyst
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Cybersecurity Professional with experience in Cybersecurity, Security Solution Architecture using SIEM, Security Penetration, Threat Exploitation, and Threat Mitigation. You will be joining a team of highly dedicated IT professionals that thrive for new challenges daily, as well as a company that demonstrates the greatest care for its employees and has a track record for sound business decisions.

Description

Location: Reading, PA

Essential Job Functions:

  • Developing Cybersecurity solutions for Network, Cloud, Gateway, and Endpoint security for Clients and the organization as a whole.
  • Liaising with customer and internal teams and divisions to gather security requirements.
  • Designing and implementing of specified security solutions within customer environments and the organization as a whole.
  • Performing health checks on implemented security solutions within customer environments and the organization as a whole.
  • Consulting with Clients and the organization on implementing security solutions based on SIEM practices.
  • Consulting with Clients to provide them with Strategic Visioning for their future Cybersecurity needs, working in unison with our various divisions to deliver forward thinking vision to Clients as well as our organization as a whole.
  • Supporting the organization’s consulting practice in delivering various IS027K, HITRUST, HIPAA, and NIST Compliant security services and consulting to our clients and the organization in whole with involvement by the Compliance Officer and Chief Information Security Officer.
  • Completing tasks designated by company management in the delivery of our services.
  • Executing client security plans, policy, and consulting supporting a program of security compliance and operational process improvement; utilizing technology and software tools to promote efficiency and breadth of service delivery.
  • Orchestrating the planning of security compliance reports, preparation of security audit and compliance programs, performing testing procedures, drafting respective reports for presentation, and assessing management action plans.
  • Performing Security Risk Assessments with the Compliance Officer and Chief Information Security Officer for the organization as a whole as well as Clients as required or requested.
  • Gathering engagement-specific information and preparing work papers in accordance with company guidelines and industry accepted standards.
  • Developing trusted relationships with IT Executives, C-Level contacts, and their respective Management teams in all engagements.
  • Working directly with the Compliance Officer and Chief Information Security Officer for the organization as a whole as well as Clients as required or requested.

Qualifications

Preferred Certifications:

  • Microsoft Certified Professionals (MCSE/MCSA/MCITP) – Server 2012/SharePoint/SQL Server/Exchange
  • VMware Certified Professionals (VCP) – ESX 5.0/ESX 5.5/Horizon View
  • Citrix Certified Engineer (CCE) - XenDesktop/XenServer
  • Cisco Certified (CCNA/CCNP/CCIE) – Security/Wireless/VoIP/Switching
  • Global Information Assurance Certifications (GIAC)
  • Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
  • Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)
  • Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)
  • HealthCare Information Security and Privacy Practitioner (HCISPP)

Basic Qualifications and Experience:

  • A minimum of 1 year of experience in a functional security role is preferred
  • A Degree in Information Technology or Business Management is preferred
  • Strong knowledge of Cybersecurity standards
  • An overall understanding of security from endpoints, to gateways, and perimeter solutions.
  • Specific skill with implementing SIEM solutions is preferred.
  • Experience with IDS/IPS, Network Security, Gateway Security, and Endpoint Security..
  • Strong Knowledge of HIPAA, HITRUST, ISO 27K, CoBit, NIST, PCI DSS, SAS70, and SSAE16 with the ability to apply that knowledge effectively as it relates to security.
  • Experience with maintaining a working security environment that is IS027K, HITRUST, PCI DSS, HIPAA, and NIST Compliant.
  • Experience with Healthcare Cybersecurity and Compliance Management is highly preferred.
  • An excellent reputation for support to end-users must be demonstrated.
  • Must have the ability to understand policy and protocol as they apply in real-world matters with Clients and the organization as a whole.
  • Must have the ability to conduct and control audit, consulting, and compliance engagements.

For consideration please send the following: cover letter, resume, references, educational transcripts or certificates, and salary requirements to

careers@crossroadstech.net

title: Soc Analyst
description:
Organization: Department of Education
Location: Washington, DC
Terms: Full Time Employment
Salary: Based on experience, education and certification
Clearance: Secret/Public Trust


Job Description:

This position requires shift work. The Tier 1 SOC Analysts support a 24/7/365 Security Operations Center and monitors security tools and provides first tier response to security incidents. The analysts follow standard operating procedures for detecting, classifying, and reporting incidents under the supervision of Tier 2 and Tier 3 staff.

Required Skills:

  • 1-2 years Security Operations Center (SOC) environment experience with security engineering and monitoring experience a MUST
  • Dedicated monitoring and analysis of cyber security events (Triage)
  • Event of Interest (EOI) handling and escalation
  • Incident Report generation and reporting
  • Processes incident communications to include initial reporting, follow-ups, requests for information and resolution activity
  • Required Experience, Skills, & Qualifications:
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Self-motivated and able to work in an independent manner.
  • COMPTIA Security + or other relevant networking or software engineering certifications
